snippet: Plastic fillings in sofas and mattresses burn faster than older fillings, leading the New York Fire Department to reconsider some long-held ideas on how to fight fires.
abstract: New York City Fire Department is rethinking its tactics for residential fires, while trying to hold onto its culture of charging inside burning buildings as fast as possible; plastic fillings in furniture burn much faster than older fillings like cotton, helping to transform the behavior of house fires in the last few decades; scientists and the Fire Department will conduct an ambitious experiment where they will burn down 20 vacant row houses stuffed with modern furniture, to gauge which techniques work best in fighting the blazes.
lead_paragraph: Plastic fillings in sofas and mattresses burn faster than older fillings, leading the New York Fire Department to reconsider some long-held ideas on how to fight fires.
